sections.title: Java Fundamentals
sections.description: Master the basics of Java programming language including syntax, data types, and control flow.

topics.title: Java Tokens
topics.explanation: Java tokens are the smallest individual building blocks of code. They include Keywords, Identifiers, Literals, Operators, and Separators.
topics.logic: Compiler breaks code into tokens during lexical analysis.
exercises: Identify tokens in: public static void main(String[] args)

topics.title: Variables
topics.explanation: Variables are containers for storing data values.
topics.example:
int myNum = 15;
String name = "John";
topics.logic:
1. Declare the type.
2. Assign a name.
3. Assign a value.
exercises: Declare an integer variable named age and assign it 25.
Create a String variable named city with value 'New York'.

topics.title: Data Types
topics.explanation: Java has two categories of data types: Primitive (int, float, char, boolean, etc.) and Non-Primitive (String, Arrays, Classes).
topics.example:
int myNum = 5;               // Integer (whole number)
float myFloatNum = 5.99f;    // Floating point number
char myLetter = 'D';         // Character
boolean myBool = true;       // Boolean
String myText = "Hello";     // String
topics.logic: Data types specify the size and type of values that can be stored.
exercises: What is the size of int?

topics.title: Operators
topics.explanation: Operators are used to perform operations on variables and values (Arithmetic, Assignment, Comparison, Logical, Bitwise).
topics.logic: Operators have precedence rules determining the order of evaluation.

topics.title: Control Statements
topics.explanation: Control statements control the flow of execution of the program (Loops: for, while, do-while; Branching: break, continue).
topics.logic: Loops repeat a block of code while a condition is true.
exercises: Write a loop to print 1 to 10.

topics.title: Conditional Statements
topics.explanation: Conditional statements execute different blocks of code based on conditions (if, if-else, switch).
topics.logic: Evaluates a boolean expression to decide execution path.
exercises: Check if a number is positive or negative.
Write a switch case for days of the week.

topics.title: Methods
topics.explanation: A method is a block of code which only runs when it is called. Methods are used to perform certain actions.
topics.logic: Code reusability and modularity.
exercises: Create a method to add two numbers.

topics.title: Static vs Non-Static
topics.explanation: Static members belong to the class, while non-static members belong to a specific instance of the class.
topics.syntax: static int x; vs int y;
topics.logic: Static memory is allocated once; Non-static memory is allocated per object.
exercises: Create an object to access non-static variable.

topics.title: Class and Object
topics.explanation: A Class is a blueprint for creating objects. An Object is an instance of a class.
topics.logic: Classes define attributes and behaviors; Objects implement them.

topics.title: Constructor
topics.explanation: A special method used to initialize objects. It is called when an object of a class is created.
topics.logic: Constructors have the same name as the class and no return type.

topics.title: this Keyword
topics.explanation: 'this' is a reference variable that refers to the current object.
topics.logic: Resolves ambiguity between instance variables and parameters.
exercises: Use 'this' to refer to instance variable.

topics.title: Access Specifiers
topics.explanation: Keywords that set the accessibility of classes, methods, and other members (public, private, protected, default).
topics.logic: Encapsulation and data hiding.

topics.title: Package
topics.explanation: A package is a group of related classes, interfaces, and sub-packages.
topics.logic: Organizes files and prevents naming conflicts.

topics.title: Object Class
topics.explanation: The Object class is the root of the class hierarchy. Every class has Object as a superclass.
topics.example:
MyClass obj = new MyClass();
System.out.println(obj.toString());
topics.logic: Provides common methods like toString(), equals(), hashCode().

topics.title: String Class
topics.explanation: String is a sequence of characters. In Java, String is an object that represents a sequence of char values.
topics.logic: Strings are immutable in Java.
exercises: Create a string using new keyword.

topics.title: String Functions
topics.explanation: Common methods available in String class for manipulation.
topics.example:
String txt = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
System.out.println("The length of the txt string is: " + txt.length());
topics.logic: Perform operations like searching, splitting, comparing.

sections.title: Programming Logic Practice
sections.description: Develop algorithmic thinking with 20 distinct programs per topic. Each topic includes logic breakdown, animation, and solution.

programs.title: Factorial of a Number (Iterative)
programs.statement: Write a program to calculate the factorial of a given number using a for loop.

programs.title: Factorial using Recursion
programs.statement: Calculate factorial using a recursive method.
logicSteps: Base case: if n is 0, return 1

programs.title: Factorial of Large Number (BigInteger)
programs.statement: Calculate factorial for large numbers where int/long is insufficient.

programs.title: Sum of Factorials of Digits
programs.statement: Find if sum of factorials of digits equals the number (Strong Number).

programs.title: Trailing Zeros in Factorial
programs.statement: Count number of trailing zeros in n!

programs.title: Fibonacci Series up to N terms
programs.statement: Print the Fibonacci series up to N terms using iteration.

programs.title: Nth Fibonacci Number
programs.statement: Find the Nth number in Fibonacci series.

programs.title: Check if Number is Fibonacci
programs.statement: Check if a given number belongs to Fibonacci series.

programs.title: Check Prime Number
programs.statement: Check if a number is prime.

programs.title: Primes between 1 to N
programs.statement: Print all primes up to N.

programs.title: Reverse String using Loop
programs.statement: Reverse a string character by character.

programs.title: Check Odd/Even
programs.statement: Check if number is odd or even.

programs.title: Right Triangle Star Pattern
programs.statement: Print a right triangle of stars.

programs.title: Bubble Sort Implementation
programs.statement: Sort an array using Bubble Sort algorithm.

programs.title: Optimized Bubble Sort
programs.statement: Stop if no swaps in a pass.

programs.title: Pass Primitive Type
programs.statement: Demonstrate that changing parameter doesn't affect original.

programs.title: Pass Object Reference
programs.statement: Demonstrate changing object field affects original.

programs.title: Understanding Reference
programs.statement: Java technically only has Pass by Value. Demonstrate this.

programs.title: Swapping Objects
programs.statement: Try swapping two objects in a method.

sections.title: OOP Concepts
sections.description: Understand Object Oriented Programming concepts (Inheritance, Polymorphism, Abstraction, Encapsulation).

topics.title: Inheritance
topics.explanation: Mechanism where one class acquires properties of another class.
topics.logic: Use 'extends' keyword. Supports code reusability.

topics.title: Method Overloading
topics.explanation: Multiple methods with same name but different parameters.
topics.logic: Compile-time polymorphism.
exercises: Overload a method to add integers and doubles.

topics.title: Method Overriding
topics.explanation: Subclass provides specific implementation of a method declared in superclass.
topics.example:
class Vehicle { void run(){...} }
class Bike extends Vehicle { void run(){...} }
topics.logic: Runtime polymorphism. Rules: same name, same params, IS-A relationship.

topics.title: Polymorphism
topics.explanation: Ability to take multiple forms. Two types: Compile-time (Overloading) and Runtime (Overriding).
topics.example:
Shape s = new Circle();
s.draw();
topics.logic: Allows treating objects of different classes through a common interface.
exercises: Create a Shape interface and implement in Circle/Rect.

topics.title: Typecasting
topics.explanation: Converting one data type to another (Upcasting / Downcasting).
topics.example:
double d = 9.78;
int i = (int) d; // Manual casting
topics.logic: Widening is automatic; Narrowing requires manual cast.

topics.title: Abstraction
topics.explanation: Hiding internal details and showing only functionality.
topics.logic: Achieved using abstract classes and interfaces.
exercises: Create an abstract class with one abstract method.

topics.title: Abstract Class
topics.explanation: A class that cannot be instantiated and may contain abstract methods.
topics.example: abstract class Base { ... }
topics.logic: Can have constructors and static methods also.
exercises: Can we instantiate an abstract class?

topics.title: Interface
topics.explanation: A blueprint of a class having static constants and abstract methods.
topics.logic: Supports multiple inheritance.
exercises: Implement two interfaces in one class.

topics.title: Encapsulation
topics.explanation: Wrapping code and data together into a single unit.
topics.logic: Data hiding using private variables and public getters/setters.

topics.title: Composition
topics.explanation: Design technique to implement has-a relationship.
topics.logic: Stronger relationship than Aggregation.
exercises: Create a Library class having Books.

sections.title: Advanced Java
sections.description: Deep dive into advanced Java topics like Exception Handling, Collections, and Threads.

topics.title: Exception Handling
topics.explanation: Mechanism to handle runtime errors.
topics.logic: Maintains normal flow of application.

topics.title: Collections
topics.explanation: Framework to store and manipulate group of objects.
topics.example:
ArrayList<String> list = new ArrayList<String>();
list.add("Ravi");
topics.logic: Provides standard data structures.

topics.title: Maps
topics.explanation: Object that maps keys to values.
topics.example:
HashMap<Integer,String> map = new HashMap<>();
map.put(1, "Mango");
topics.logic: No duplicate keys allowed.

topics.title: File Handling
topics.explanation: Reading and writing to files.
topics.example: File myObj = new File("filename.txt");
topics.logic: Uses classes like FileWriter, FileReader.

topics.title: Threads
topics.explanation: Smallest unit of processing. Multi-threading allows concurrent execution.
topics.example: class MyThread extends Thread { ... }
topics.logic: Extends Thread class or implements Runnable interface.
exercises: Create a thread by extending Thread.
